thread.title: Rain: Cyclonic Circulation Over J’khand To Cause Widespread Rain In Ne | Guwahati News
thread.title_full: Rain: Cyclonic Circulation Over J’khand To Cause Widespread Rain In Ne | Guwahati News - Times of India

author: Mukut Das
title: Rain: Cyclonic Circulation Over J’khand To Cause Widespread Rain In Ne | Guwahati News
text: Guwahati: Rain may play spoilsport during Holi, which will be celebrated here on Monday, as the IMD has forecast widespread rain over the northeast region till Tuesday.The Met department in a press communiqué stated that a cyclonic circulation over north Jharkhand and a trough running from this circulation to Manipur in lower tropospheric levels were marked.Sanjay O’Neil Shaw, deputy DG of meteorology of Regional Meteorological Centre, Guwahati, said fairly widespread or widespread light to moderate rainfall with isolated thunderstorms and lightning is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura till Tuesday.He also said isolated heavy rainfall or snowfall is also likely over Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, Saturday and Monday and isolated heavy rainfall over Assam and Meghalaya on Friday, Saturday and Monday.Light to moderate rainfall lashed several places in Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura in the last 24 hours.According to the IMD data, Assam received 4.3 mm rain, which is 1.3mm more than normal, in the last 24 hours while its neighbor Meghalaya received 5.7mm (2.9 mm more than normal), Arunachal Pradesh received 6.5 mm (1.5 mm more than normal) and Manipur received 4.3 mm (1.4 mm more than normal). Conflict ensued over entry permissions and anti-CAA sentiments. ABVP allegedly assaulted PG Students Union members, leading to injuries and hospitalizations.108597280Heavy rains: Met issues orange alert for todayRaipur, Bilaspur, Korba experienced rain and winds. Yellow alert for Wednesday. Surguja, Bastar, Raipur, Durg expected drizzles, thunderstorms. Jashpur, Kondagaon, Bijapur, Narayanpur, Rajnandgaon, Mahasamund, Sukma, Dantewada, Balrampur, Koriya at risk of severe weather.108630039
